I've received numerous compliments about this watch. Several reviews have stated that it stopped working after about a month or so. So I waited. In the meantime, I've abused this watch. I took it hunting. I wore it when I worked on my truck. I subjected it to the recoil of a high caliber firearm. Remarkably, it still keeps pretty good time, and the finish hasn't shown nearly as many blemishes as I expected. It does squeak a bit though. Some fine oil and a good wash will most likely take care of everything though.  One note, the locking post for the clasp broke free from the band at one point. I was able to press it back into place with basic hand tools, and it's been perfectly fine ever since.  Frankly Im shocked by how much I like this watch, despite it being so ostentatious. It wears surprisingly well. If you can look past and forgive the quirks and rough edges, it's honestly pretty good.  It's a bit fast when fully wound, so expect to make an adjustment at least once a week. Nothing major, a few minutes usually.

It might be titanium nitride. This is my second Amazon mechanical watch and I really liked my first one until the stickers came delaminated. Hopefully one day I'll be able to buy a real tourbillon.  Edit as expected a temperature change of about 10 degrees for 10 minutes makes it lose time by about a minute. Still pretty

评论概述: Looks like an expensive watch, movement is not fully skeleton design
评论详情: I purchased this watch for $40 just to see how much the industry has improved appearance for low cost skeleton watches. I was impressed at the case, and even the metal band is fairly nice for this price point.  The photos do not show that the rear of the watch does not allow much visibility of internal parts and gears, as if the movement was not intended to be a skeleton design but somehow there was just enough design effort made to create the effect of open structure on the front while not removing any of the back plate of the movement.  The appearance is acceptable, but one look at the back shows that the movement blocks almost all sightlines through the watch, making it a partially skeleton movement with much of the internal parts hidden from view.  The watch looks good and keeps time within a few seconds per day, so I consider it a reasonable value for the price. I posted a review on the Pagani Design Blue Silver 1638 that I purchased from Amazon for about $80. Much better in every way, and also a great value for the price.

Got this watch for my son and I needed to pull a few links out to make it fit. Usually that is no big deal the arrows show the direction the pins go. But these pins have been touched by the gods of crazy glue. We bent all the rods that came with the watch as well as 2 from my other watch kit. This watch will definitely get attention. However the quality of the watch is actually terrible. But let’s go in order  Pros: cost. What you get definitely equates to the cost. Functions as stated. (A 10-15 second loss every week is noticed) Looks great Easy to adjust  Cons: band quality is flimsy and very hollow sounding. If you wear the watch properly fitted is not super noticeable. The bezel of my watch fell off, like just popped off randomly as I was typing on a keyboard.  I cannot recommend this purchase to someone who needs an everyday wear watch. The Bezel popped off after 1 week of continuous use. I tried popping it back on Bc it is a snug fit but after a few hours it comes right back off.  If I had not experienced the bezel issue I would 100 percent be able to recommend this watch at this price point.

评论概述: Not useful for actual time keeping
评论详情: This Watch is pretty decent looking overall. It definitely looks a bit better in the video than in person.  We'll start with the bad.  The watch band is an absolute pain to adjust. I broke 2 of the adjustment tools trying, and finally just used a vice clamp and pliers (very carefully to not scratch or damage the watch.). It took me about 30 minutes to remove 2 links on mine. The pins that hold the links together were extremely tight. Because of how tight the links are, they will sometimes bind. There are also small fairings on the metal that catch on the other links. What this means is that the watch band gets kinked a lot, as shown in the video. The watch band is also very cheap sounding, and pretty cheap feeling when taking it on and off.  The watch itself runs pretty slowly. I've already had to re-adjust the time 3 or 4 times and I've only had it for a day. There's a lot going on too, so it can be tricky to read the time very quickly.  For the good,  The watch looks pretty nice, and isnt too expensive. I love being able to see the inner workings on the watch, and watch it tick. Other than that, there's not too much to say about it. The paint scratches very easily, and so does the glass.  I give it a 2/5. Left a lot to be desired, but I've seen worse at the price point. Wouldn't recommend this watch if you need to actually keep the time.
